intro: Babingtonia subcuneata, commonly known as the narrow-angled babingtonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained, sandy soils. Babingtonia subcuneata is also valued for its ability to thrive in coastal environments.
